name: Angkor Wat
description: Ancient temple complex and UNESCO World Heritage site
longDes: Angkor is one of the most important archaeological sites in South-East Asia. Stretching over some 400 km2, including forested area, Angkor Archaeological Park contains the magnificent remains of the different capitals of the Khmer Empire, from the 9th to the 15th century. They include the famous Temple of Angkor Wat and, at Angkor Thom, the Bayon Temple with its countless sculptural decorations. UNESCO has set up a wide-ranging programme to safeguard this symbolic site and its surroundings.

name: National Museum of Cambodia
description: Cultural museum showcasing Khmer art and history
longDes: The National Museum of Cambodia is Cambodia's largest museum of cultural history and the country's leading historical and archaeological museum, located in Chey Chumneas, Phnom Penh.It houses one of the world's largest collections of Khmer art, including sculptural, ceramic, bronze, and ethnographic objects, with over 14,000 items spanning from prehistoric times to periods before, during, and after the Khmer Empire.

name: Phnom Penh Royal Palace
description: Majestic royal residence with beautiful architecture
longDes: The Royal Palace of Phnom Penh, located on Samdech Sothearos Boulevard, is a prominent symbol of Cambodia's monarchy and a key architectural landmark in the capital city.Construction began in 1866 under King Norodom I, who relocated the capital from Oudong to Phnom Penh, selecting the site for its geographical significance and spiritual importance.The palace complex spans 174,870 square metres (approximately 402m x 435m) and features a blend of traditional Khmer architecture and French colonial influences, with golden roofs, ornate gilding, and intricate carvings

name: Koh Rong Samloem
description: Tropical island paradise with pristine beaches
longDes: Koh Rong Samloem is Koh Rong’s stunning sister island. It is a peaceful relaxing destination with breathtaking scenery – Pristine white beaches, clear turquoise ocean waters, and a tropical jungle wilderness. A real ‘island paradise’ – As it is often called by tourists. Here’s all the information on Koh Rong Samloem’s beaches, tourism, history, geography, and villages.
